definition: scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
psychologist
physicist
geographer
pathologist
physiologist
astrophysicist
pinyin: tian1 ti3 wu4 li3 xue2 jia1

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理學家們對自己的學科都頗爲自鳴得意。

sentences.english: One of the Meccas for the leading physicists of that time was in Gottingen.
sentences.chinese: 那個時候引導物理學家的麥加聖地之一，是哥廷根。

sentences.english: Psychologists could also identify the key ages that best allow for the memorization of classical texts.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家也可以幫助確定最適於記憶經典文本的年齡。

sentences.english: Social psychologists always are interested in inter-group behavior researches.
sentences.chinese: 羣際行爲研究一直是社會心理學家的興趣所在。

sentences.english: Li Siguang is a famous geographer.
sentences.chinese: 李四光是一位著名的地理學家。

sentences.english: Psychologists and psychiatrists say that children should be handled with care.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家和精神病專家說孩子需要小心呵護。

sentences.english: To preserve the theory, physicists would have to make some changes. [Video: Dark Matter in 3-D]
sentences.chinese: 爲了保持這個理論，物理學家就必須去做某些修改。

sentences.english: Thus, neurophysiologists tell us that lobsters do not process pain.
sentences.chinese: 但是，神經生理學家告訴我們龍蝦感知不到疼痛。

sentences.english: This is what psychologists dream about at night.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家做夢也會夢到這些。

sentences.english: The successful physicist never puts on airs.
sentences.chinese: 這位卓有成就的物理學家從不搭架子。

sentences.english: The quote comes from this fairly well-known physicist.
sentences.chinese: 引自這位著名的物理學家。

sentences.english: Chenbaisha, who developed the neo-Confucianism here in Ming-dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明代理學家陳白沙也曾在此講學。

sentences.english: As psychologists we have to question the natural.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家要對自然而然的反應提出疑問。

sentences.english: This sentence pattern is actually a favorite of psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個句型是心理學家最喜歡用的。

sentences.english: Spirited debates have erupted between physicists concerning these wormholes.
sentences.chinese: 之間爆發了熱烈的爭論，就這些蟲洞物理學家。

sentences.english: I'm a geophysicist, and I've trained my students to find oil.
sentences.chinese: 我是地球物理學家，我培訓我的學生們尋找石油。

definition: Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
to narrate/narrative
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
respect for the wise
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Zhang Ji (767-830), Tang Dynasty poet
